Warm-up (2-3 min)

Week 17 review:

Who goes? → ?
What is this? → ?
How many? → ?

(Answers: ma klama, ti mo, xo)

New Material (5-7 min)

What Are Attitudinals?

Attitudinals express emotions. They're NOT part of the bridi — they add emotional color.

Basic Attitudinals

Cmavo Emotion Usage
.ui happiness .ui mi klama (Happy! I go)
.uinai unhappiness .uinai do klama (Sad! You go)
.uu pity/compassion .uu do terpa (Pity! You're afraid)
.u'i amusement .u'i ti (Amusing! This)
.oi pain/complaint .oi mi tatpi (Ow! I'm tired)

Using Attitudinals

Attitudinals can go almost anywhere:

.ui mi klama

(Happy!) I go.

mi .ui klama

I (happily) go.

mi klama .ui

I go (yay!).

The nai Suffix

Adding nai reverses the emotion:

Base With nai
.ui (happy) .uinai (unhappy)
.oi (pain) .oinai (pleasure)

Key Point

Attitudinals express YOUR emotions. They don't change the truth of the bridi.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Add Emotions

Add appropriate attitudinal:

  1. I go. (happy) → ?
  2. You're afraid. (pity) → ?
  3. This is funny. (amused) → ?
Answers
  1. .ui mi klama
  2. .uu do terpa
  3. .u'i ti

Exercise 2: Identify Emotions

What emotion does each express?

  1. .ui mi gleki
  2. .uu la .bob. cu bilma
  3. .oi mi tatpi
Answers
  1. Happiness — Happy! I am happy.
  2. Pity — Poor thing! Bob is sick.
  3. Pain/complaint — Ow! I'm tired.

Exercise 3: Negative Forms

Use the negative form:

  1. I go. (unhappy) → ?
  2. This happened. (not amused) → ?
Answers
  1. .uinai mi klama
  2. .u'inai ti fasnu

items.answer: Pity — Poor thing! Bob is sick.

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "Happy! I understand." → .ui mi jimpe
  2. "Pity! You're afraid." → .uu do terpa
  3. "Ow! This hurts." → .oi ti

Summary

You learned basic attitudinals: .ui (happy), .uu (pity), .u'i (amused), .oi (pain). Use nai to reverse.
